amendment.description: Amendment sought to delete $90 million appropriated for the Market Access Program.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 11 in the Congressional Record of June 11, 1996, to prohibit the use of funds appropriated in the bill to pay the salaries of personnel carrying out the Market Access Program, which provides grants to businesses and trade associations to promote agricultural exports. The amendment would also reduce funding for the Commodity Credit Corporation by $90 million.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Schumer amendment (A009) Failed by voice vote.
